page.title: 11BRECON FOREST TRAMROAD
page.content: When the Great Forest of Brecknock was enclosed and sold off by the Crown at the end of the Napoleonic Wars, a considerable part of that land was bought by J.Christie,a London indigo merchant. Amongst his developments in the area was the tramroad extending from the upper part of the Swansea valley to Castell Du near Sennybridge. The small trucks were pulled by horse. Work on this started in 1821 and the tramroad operated until the 1860's, although by then it had changed hands several times.At that time Fforest Fach had already been divided amongst various owners and Christie (who for some years was Lord of the Manor) had to negotiate the route through Cwm Treweren. Much of the site of this tramroad may still be identified where it lies slightly higher than the old Neath and Brecon railway track.
